senses.sense_definition: A strong, thick rope made of twisted wire or hemp, or a bundle of insulated wires used for carrying electricity or electronic signals.

examples.text: The workers repaired the damaged power <w>cable</w> after the storm.
He used a heavy steel <w>cable</w> to tow the broken truck.

senses.sense_definition: A system of broadcasting television programmes or providing internet access using wires rather than radio waves.

examples.text: We decided to cancel our <w>cable</w> subscription and switch to streaming services.
Do you have <w>cable</w> or satellite TV at your house?

senses.sense_definition: A message sent by telegraph, especially across the ocean via underwater wires.

examples.text: He received an urgent <w>cable</w> from his business partners in London.
In the past, sending a <w>cable</w> was the fastest way to communicate internationally.

senses.sense_definition: A pattern in knitting that looks like twisted rope, made by crossing stitches over each other.

examples.text: This wool sweater features a beautiful <w>cable</w> design down the front.
She learned how to knit a complex <w>cable</w> pattern for the scarf.

senses.sense_definition: A nautical unit of length, approximately equal to 185 meters or one tenth of a nautical mile.

examples.text: The ship anchored about one <w>cable</w> away from the shore.
Navigators estimate distances in <w>cables</w> when approaching the harbor.

senses.sense_definition: The exchange rate between the British pound and the United States dollar.

examples.text: Traders watched the <w>cable</w> closely as the economic news was released.
The value of <w>cable</w> dropped significantly after the announcement.

senses.sense_definition: To send a message or money to someone by telegraph.

examples.text: The reporter <w>cabled</w> the breaking news back to the newspaper headquarters.
She <w>cabled</w> her parents to let them know she had arrived safely.

senses.sense_definition: To provide a building or area with cables for electricity or television, or to fasten something with a cable.

examples.text: The electrician is coming tomorrow to <w>cable</w> the new office for internet access.
They <w>cabled</w> the heavy machinery to the floor to prevent it from moving.

senses.sense_definition: To knit stitches in a twisted pattern that resembles a rope.

examples.text: You can <w>cable</w> without a special needle if you are careful with the stitches.
She <w>cabled</w> the front of the sweater to give it a traditional look.
Mr. <w>Cable</w> has been appointed as the new director of the board.
We are looking for the records of a family named <w>Cable</w>.

senses.sense_definition: A place name used for various locations in the United States.

examples.text: They visited the small community of <w>Cable</w> during their road trip.
The town of <w>Cable</w> is known for its quiet atmosphere.
